title: 72 Best Weeknight Steak Dinners - Easy Steak Recipes & Ideas
body: <style type="text/css">#sidepanel{transform:translateX(0);visibility:visible;content-visibility:auto;}@media (max-width:425px){#sidepanel{width:7rem;max-width:7rem;}#sidepanel .nav-item,#sidepanel .nav-item a,#sidepanel footer a,#sidepanel div a,#sidepanel a span{font-size:10px;}#sidepanel ul,#sidepanel div{padding:0;margin:0;}#sidepanel button{display:none;}}</style>SearchMy RecipesSubscribeMembership BenefitsRecipesMealsHolidaysFood TrendsNewsKitchen Tips & ToolsAll VideosAbout UsNewsletterDelish ShopFollowOther EditionsYour Privacy ChoicesPrivacy NoticeTerms Of UseSkip to ContentRecipesDinnersSpring RecipesKitchen TipsNewsSubscribesign inSearchLemon Blueberry DessertsSpring SaladsCopycat Recipe IdeasBrunch RecipesSpring DinnersMeals & CookingRecipe Headquarters72 Steak Recipes That'll Put Your Favorite Steakhouse To Shame72 Steak Recipes That'll Put Your Favorite Steakhouse To ShameYou got this.By Mackenzie Filson and Camille LowderUpdated: Feb 6, 2025Save ArticlePHOTO: RYAN LIEBE; FOOD STYLING: SAM SENEVIRATNEOn the hunt for meal that'll impress at dinner (but you're strapped for time)? Look no further than a steak dinner. We can all agree—there’s nothing more impressive than a perfectly cooked steak. They’re kind of the end-all-be-all of romantic date night options, and are pretty perfect for casual weeknight dinners too. While we do love the ambiance at our local steakhouse, we also like being able to cook up restaurant-level meals at home. (Bonus: You can get it just as rare or as well-done as you like it!) Feeling overwhelmed at all the cuts and cooking methods? Don't be! We've got all the tips and tricks to get you ready to grill a steak, pan-fry a steak, cook a steak in the oven, and more. These 72 easy (and wildly delicious) steak recipes, like creamy steak fettuccine, classic Philly cheesesteaks, and carne asada, are sure to satisfy even the hungriest carnivore.First things first, whatever method you choose to cook your steak, you'll want it to get really, really hot. So crank it up! If you're cooking your steak on the stove or the grill, as soon as your meat makes contact with the surface, you should instantly hear that beautiful sizzle. That sound means you'll be getting a beautiful sear. Want to get really fancy? Try reverse searing your steak.Not sure which cut of steak to grill? We've got a guide to all the kinds of steak every home cook should know, like filet mignon, ribeye, and flatiron steak. And if you didn't already know that air fryers are basically magic, once you try our air-fryer steak, you definitely will.With all these steak recipes, you're going to need some worthy side dishes to finish your meal. Here's all our favorite sides for steak (that aren't just potatoes, although we do love those oh so much), and we bet you'll want to try them all. Still can't get enough? Try our favorite grilled steak recipes and best-ever healthy steak recipes too. Not a red meat fan? We got you—check out our favorite weeknight chicken or seafood dinners instead.1Picanha SteakPHOTO: BRYAN GARDNER; FOOD STYLING: TIFFANY SCHLEIGHIf you’ve ever wondered how to re-create a Brazilian-style steakhouse dinner at home, this is the recipe for you. We found that all you need is a hot grill, metal skewers, and kosher salt (or sea salt) to make this churrascaria-quality steak everyone will love.Get the Picanha Steak recipe. 2Steak With Bourbon Garlic Cream SaucePHOTO: DOAA ELKADY; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GORESteak will always say “I love you,” but if you want to really jazz it up for your next date night, make this 12-ounce strip with a creamy bourbon garlic sauce. Seared until deeply browned, basted in garlicky butter, and served with a dreamy pan gravy, this steak is the perfect centerpiece for any special occasion dinner.Get the Steak With Bourbon Garlic Cream Sauce recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below3Cowboy Butter SteakPHOTO: RYAN LIEBE; FOOD STYLING: SAM SENEVIRATNECowboy butter and a juicy ribeye are a match made in heaven, so it’s no wonder that this rich, smoky topping completely dominated social media lately. Not to be confused with our equally delicious cowboy steak, this recipe calls for searing a bone-in ribeye, then basting it with a zesty, smoky butter until the outside has a perfectly brown crust, and the inside is tender and medium-rare.Get the Cowboy Butter Steak recipe. 4Philly Cheesesteak PastaPHOTO: LINDA PUGLIESE; FOOD STYLING: ADRIENNE ANDERSONThis cheesy pasta skillet, which combines tender skirt steak, sautéed peppers, onions, and mushrooms, and creamy provolone all in one pan, is something you'll find you can't resist. The real one-pan magic happens when the pasta is simmered in beef broth and half-and-half, soaking up all those rich flavors. Once the cavatappi reaches al dente perfection, the dish is finished with melty provolone, turning it into the ultimate savory skillet dinner.Get the Philly Cheesesteak Pasta recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below5Instant Pot PhoLucy schaeffer Ask any seasoned pho-fessional, and they'll tell you that making this Vietnamese beef bone-based soup will take you hours. If you want to try to recreate it without the same time investment, one of the best ways to do this is by using a pressure cooker!Get the Instant Pot Pho recipe.6Mongolian Beef RamenPHOTO: MURRAY HALL; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREMongolian beef is a popular American-Chinese takeout dish made with thin slices of flank steak, accompanied by veggies, spiked with ginger, soy sauce, sugar, garlic, and scallions. Tossed with another nostalgic favorite, ramen noodles, this is instant comfort in a skillet.Get the Mongolian Beef Ramen recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below7Beef & BroccoliPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: TAYLOR ANN SPENCERA quintessential Chinese-American dish, beef and broccoli is a classic that graces the menu at almost every takeout spot across the country. In terms of popularity, it's right up there with orange chicken, and for very good reason: The combination of tender, seared beef and broccoli tossed in a garlicky, velvety sauce is practically impossible to resist.Get the Beef & Broccoli recipe. 8Flank Steak MarinadePHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: TAYLOR ANN SPENCEROur simple marinade has just four ingredients and is the perfect way to prep flank steak for the grill. While acidic citrus juice and salty soy sauce act to both season and tenderize the steak, olive oil helps to keep the meat supple and juicy. A small amount of brown sugar brings out the meat's natural sweetness and helps to create a slightly caramelized crust once the steak hits the grill.Get the Flank Steak Marinade recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below9Steak Kebab BowlsPHOTO: RACHEL VANNI; FOOD STYLING: ADRIENNE ANDERSONNothing screams summer quite like rainbow veggie kebabs dotted with succulent cubes of marinated steak, charred to perfection over the grill. We complete this dish by resting the kebabs over a bed of crunchy spinach and cucumber salad tossed in a garlicky tahini dressing, plus a pile of herby orzo, which is toasted until golden before being gently simmered in savory chicken stock. Get the Steak Kebab Bowls recipe.10Cheesesteak Stuffed PeppersPHOTO: LUCY SCHAEFFER; FOOD STYLING: SPENCER RICHARDSIf you can't get enough of the classic Philly cheesesteak but are craving a low-carb version, this is the recipe for you. Filled with tender sirloin steak, mushrooms, onions, and two slices of cheese, these tender, soft peppers give a welcome veggie boost to the beloved sandwich's iconic flavors.Get the Cheesesteak Stuffed Peppers recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below11Outback Steakhouse Tasmanian ChiliPHOTO: JOSEPH DE LEO; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREWhile we have tons of great chili recipes—white chicken, vegetarian, Instant Pot—this copycat Outback Steakhouse Tasmanian Chili stands out as one of the best. This Texas-style chili is loaded with tender pieces of steak, plenty of spices, and a thick tomato-chili base. But don’t even think about adding beans (we repeat, no beans!). Even if you've never experienced Outback’s chili, this recipe will quickly become a favorite in your chili lineup.Get the Outback Steakhouse Tasmanian Chili recipe. 12Cajun Butter SteakPHOTO: BRYAN GARDNER; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONGrilled steak is pretty incredible all on its own, but if you're looking for a total flavor upgrade, turn to this homemade Cajun butter. Cajun seasoning, bourbon, and more combine to create an irresistible marinade which flavors the steak before we throw it on the grill. While it's grilling, you'll make a homemade Cajun butter that goes perfectly on top of this steak (and honestly, any other grilled protein). Get the Cajun Butter Steak recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below13Steak & Potato SkilletPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: TAYLOR ANN SPENCERIn this simple version of the dynamic duo, a skillet of crispy potatoes and tender, seared flank steak gets bathed in a tangy, savory garlic mustard butter sauce. Now that’s what we mean by interesting. Make it a complete meal by adding a simple arugula salad or your favorite oven-roasted veggie.Get the Steak & Potato Skillet recipe. 14Dirty Martini Steak FritesPHOTO: ROCKY LUTEN; FOOD STYLING: MAKINZE GOREDon’t let the frozen fries fool you—this is a meal for grown-ups. Seared medium-rare steak gets topped with a buttery, boozy olive sauce, sprinkled with blue cheese crumbles, and served alongside a mountain of golden, crispy French fries and a 2-minute leafy green salad. Serve with a chilled dirty martini for extra points.Get the Dirty Martini Steak Frites recipe. Advertisement - Continue Reading Below15Cowboy Steak Erik bernsteinUnleash your inner Bill Pickett and feed your whole posse with this hearty, flavorful cut of beef. Cowboy steak is one of the many names for the ever-popular rib eye, with the distinguishing features of a slightly protruding rib bone and a thickness of 2 1/2 to 3 inches.Get the Cowboy Steak recipe. 16Steak Frites SaladPHOTO: ANDREW BUI; FOOD STYLING: ERIKA JOYCEIn French, steak frites translates to steak and fries, simple as that. A common dish at bistros in France, Belgium, and beyond, we took the concept and combined it with American steakhouse vibes for this all-in-one steak frites salad.Get the Steak Frites Salad recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below17Beef & Broccoli RamenPHOTO: ROCKY LUTEN; FOOD STYLING: TAYLOR ANN SPENCERRamen noodles are king in the weeknight dinner hack department. We’ve tossed them into creamy chicken soup, transformed them into sophisticated carbonara, and even packed them into buns for burgers, but this take on classic beef and broccoli might be our favorite. Thinly sliced steak and tender broccoli join those unmistakable noodles in a savory ginger soy sauce for an all-in-one dinner that’s sure to become a weeknight classic.Get the Beef & Broccoli Ramen recipe. 18Ribeye SteakPHOTO: KATE JORDAN; FOOD STYLING: BROOKE CAISONRich, juicy and extra-flavorful, ribeye is a great choice when you're looking for a homemade steak dinner to impress. Follow our tips & tricks for perfecting your ribeye right at home, and you just might have the most special date night-in yet.Get the Ribeye Steak recipe.Advertisement - Continue Reading Below19Air Fryer Beef & BroccoliERIK BERNSTEINThis classic Chinese-American dish features tender strips of beef, perfectly cooked broccoli florets, and a savory-sweet sauce. Bonus: Since it only takes 30 minutes, it might be even faster than takeout!Get the Air Fryer Beef & Broccoli recipe.20Steak Au Poivre SoupPHOTO: LUCY SCHAEFFER; FOOD STYLING: SPENCER RICHARDSSteak au poivre is a French classic (not to be confused with steak Diane), typically made with filet mignon or sirloin steak covered in a creamy, peppery sauce. The sauce is downright drinkable and was made to be eaten with a spoon, so we thought—let’s soup-ify it!Get the Steak Au Poivre Soup recipe.Watch Next Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowWildly Delicious Weeknight DinnersEnchilada CasseroleCauliflower TacosChicken FajitasCacio E Pepe ChickenAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowPork Dumpling BowlsGreek Orzo SaladCheesy Taco Bake82 Simple Spring DinnersLemon Asparagus Pasta21 Recipes Meghan Markle Would Approve OfChicken Shawarma BowlsChicken & Broccoli CasseroleAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowNewsletterSubscribeManage SubscriptionAbout UsDelish Test KitchenMedia KitCommunity GuidelinesAdvertise With UsDelish Shop Product SupportOther Hearst SubscriptionsDelish Unlimited Membership SupportTurn off Web NotificationsA Part of Hearst Digital MediaWe may earn commission from links on this page, but we only recommend products we back.©2025 Hearst Magazine Media, Inc. You \u003cem\u003egot\u003c/em\u003e this.\u003c/p\u003e","short_title":"72 Next-Level Brilliant Ways To Cook Steak","index_title":"72 Steak Recipes That'll Put Your Favorite Steakhouse To Shame","introductory_text":"\u003cp\u003eOn the hunt for meal that'll impress at dinner (but you're strapped for time)? Look no further than a steak dinner. We can all agree—there’s nothing more impressive than a perfectly cooked steak. They’re kind of the end-all-be-all of \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/holiday-recipes/valentines-day/g2524/romantic-dinner-for-two/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eromantic date night\u003c/a\u003e options, and are pretty perfect for casual \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/weeknight-dinners/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eweeknight dinners\u003c/a\u003e too. While we do love the ambiance at our local steakhouse, we also like being able to cook up restaurant-level meals at home. (Bonus: You can get it just as rare or as well-done as you like it!) Feeling overwhelmed at all the cuts and cooking methods? Don't be! We've got all the tips and tricks to get you ready to \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a23145005/how-to-grill-steak/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003egrill a steak\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a23365148/how-to-pan-fry-steak/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003epan-fry a steak\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a21566115/how-to-cook-steak-in-the-oven/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ecook a steak in the oven\u003c/a\u003e, and more. These 72 easy (and wildly delicious) steak recipes, like \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a19867560/creamy-steak-fettuccine-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ecreamy steak fettuccine\u003c/a\u003e, classic \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/recipes/a54006/easy-homemade-philly-cheesesteak-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ePhilly cheesesteaks\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a39427643/carne-asada-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ecarne asada\u003c/a\u003e, are sure to satisfy even the hungriest carnivore.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eFirst things first, whatever method you choose to \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/a21756910/best-way-to-cook-steak/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ecook your steak\u003c/a\u003e, you'll want it to get really, really hot. So crank it up! If you're cooking your steak on the stove or the \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/entertaining/g1634/unusual-grilling-recipes/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003egrill\u003c/a\u003e, as soon as your meat makes contact with the surface, you should instantly hear that beautiful sizzle. That sound means you'll be getting a beautiful sear. Want to get really fancy? Try \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/holiday-recipes/valentines-day/a30472435/reverse-sear-steak-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003e\u003cem\u003ereverse\u003c/em\u003e searing your steak\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eNot sure which cut of steak to grill? We've got a \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/g36557747/types-of-steak/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eguide to all the kinds of steak\u003c/a\u003e every home cook should know, like \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a23515113/how-to-cook-filet-mignon/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003efilet mignon\u003c/a\u003e, \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a33010975/ribeye-steak-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eribeye\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a33522249/grilled-flat-iron-steak-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eflatiron steak\u003c/a\u003e. And if you didn't already know that air fryers are basically magic, once you try our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/recipe-ideas/a28638368/air-fryer-steak-recipe/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eair-fryer steak\u003c/a\u003e, you definitely will.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003eWith all these steak recipes, you're going to need some worthy \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/g1970/side-dishes/\"\u003eside dishes\u003c/a\u003e to finish your meal. Here's all our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/g4582/side-dishes-for-steak/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003efavorite sides for steak\u003c/a\u003e (that aren't just \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/entertaining/g462/potato-side-dishes/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003epotatoes\u003c/a\u003e, although we do love those oh so much), and we bet you'll want to try them all. Still can't get enough? Try our \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/entertaining/g2547/grilled-steak-recipes/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003efavorite grilled steak recipes\u003c/a\u003e and best-ever \u003ca href=\"https://www.delish.com/cooking/g1449/healthy-steak/\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ehealthy steak recipes\u003c/a\u003e too. Look no further than a steak dinner. We can all agree—there’s nothing more impressive than a perfectly cooked steak. They’re kind of the end-all-be-all of romantic date night options, and are pretty perfect for casual weeknight dinners too. While we do love the ambiance at our local steakhouse, we also like being able to cook up restaurant-level meals at home. (Bonus: You can get it just as rare or as well-done as you like it!) Feeling overwhelmed at all the cuts and cooking methods? Don't be! We've got all the tips and tricks to get you ready to grill a steak, pan-fry a steak, cook a steak in the oven, and more. These 72 easy (and wildly delicious) steak recipes, like creamy steak fettuccine, classic Philly cheesesteaks, and carne asada, are sure to satisfy even the hungriest carnivore.First things first, whatever method you choose to cook your steak, you'll want it to get really, really hot. So crank it up! If you're cooking your steak on the stove or the grill, as soon as your meat makes contact with the surface, you should instantly hear that beautiful sizzle. That sound means you'll be getting a beautiful sear. Want to get really fancy? Try reverse searing your steak.Not sure which cut of steak to grill? We've got a guide to all the kinds of steak every home cook should know, like filet mignon, ribeye, and flatiron steak. And if you didn't already know that air fryers are basically magic, once you try our air-fryer steak, you definitely will.With all these steak recipes, you're going to need some worthy side dishes to finish your meal. Here's all our favorite sides for steak (that aren't just potatoes, although we do love those oh so much), and we bet you'll want to try them all. Still can't get enough? Try our favorite grilled steak recipes and best-ever healthy steak recipes too. Not a red meat fan? We got you—check out our favorite weeknight chicken or seafood dinners
